RePublic Schools
May 29 at 9:09 PM ·

We at RePublic Schools are outraged and heartbroken by the events surrounding the recent deaths of black Americans George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery. As a network, it is our responsibility to hold our scholars, families, and staff members close as we are forced, once again, to grapple with the fatal ramifications of systemic racism and injustices in our society. We also have a responsibility to continue to look at ourselves, reflect, and talk about the role racism plays in our lives and work. We also have a responsibility as a community to think about ways to actively dismantle racism and injustice, which is why we launched our recent voter registration campaign. However, for our families who need resources to help your child process our world today, we recommend this list from the Center for Racial Justice. Know that we at RePublic Schools will continue to work to be anti-racist in our words and actions #ThisIsRePublic
